Package cs4b.proj1

Interface PlayerBehavior

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ISubject
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HPCLocal, NPCEasy, NPCHard
    public interface PlayerBehavior
extends ISubject
    This represents the behavior for a player. To request a move, call the getMove function. However, depending on the player's behavior, this may not be able to return a move immediately. To recieve the final result, addSubscriber to the PlayerBehavior and listen for its MoveInfo object.
    Author:
    Daniel Edwards

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  PlayerBehavior.MoveInfo
      When this player behavior comes up with a move, this gets sent to observers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void getMove​(Board b, char token)
      Puts in the request for a move.

      • Methods inherited from interface cs4b.proj1.observer.ISubject

        addSubscriber, removeSubscriber

    • Method Detail

      • getMove

        void getMove​(Board b,
             char token)
        Puts in the request for a move. This will eventually result in MoveInfo getting sent out to all observers.
        Parameters:
        b - The current board state.
        token - Player's token or symbol.
